data.title: Great burgers!
data.text: On Friday night we were headed to Lynn Auditorium for a concert and looking for a dinner spot.  With the show going at 8 PM, all the places recommended to us were booked solid.  We called R.F. O'Sullivan's and asked if we needed reservations - the lady who answered the phone said she was booked but that if we could get there in 30 minutes, she might have a table for us.  We headed out and arrived 45 minutes later, certain that we had lost out - but to our surprise, our table was waiting and we were shown to it immediately - off to a good start.  The staff was friendly, but very very busy, making it hard to place an order.  We eventually ordered drinks and knowing that it takes some time for the food to arrive because each burger is individually prepared, we ordered as soon as we could, mindful of the fact that others were waiting and we needed to be at the auditorium by 7:45.  Although the wait was long, it was well worth it as the burgers were juicy, perfectly cooked, tasty and delicious.  The fries were jewels - crispy, hot and perfectly salted. The restaurant is very small and tables turn over a bit slowly, but the food is just that good to make it a worthwhile stop.

data.title: Burger heaven.
data.text:
There is a burger for everyone here!
Every combination you can think of and more!
Portions are huge and I have not been able to finish one yet! Love the onion rings too!
Good service also.
Only issue was the location. Parking is hit or miss and downtown Lynn not my favorite place to be. Sidewalks were strewn with trash and definitely not the fault of the business as it was not in front of their location. We did have to walk through it to get there.
Worth a visit!

data.title: Hearty and Wholesome and Friendly
data.text: Juicy burgers , fresh salads, hand cut onion rings served with family feeling. You will not be disappointed . Next to Court house in Lynn square which means during the week after 6pm no wait. Did I mentions plenty of TVs for the Red Sox to watch while having a dinner that the Phantom Gourmet would rave about.

data.title: Consistent and wonderful food
data.text: Love this place, I moved to Lynn 15 years ago from Cambridge, used to go to the Somerville location frequently . Was thrilled that they opened a location in Lynn. Food is great, lots of good drafts. Staff is very accommodating and friendly. Planning on going there for lunch tomorrow....

data.title: great place for a burger
data.text: I am not sure which is better, the food or the service?  Both are great!!! So many choices for the type of burger you want.  Plus the veggie burger is delicious and they will substitute it on any burger option.  Try their root beer, very similar to the IBC brand. Pub like atmosphere adds to the comfort level.  Staff are personable and friendly, perfect combination.  Prices are reasonable too.

data.title: usually crowded, staff out paced by crowd, food was mediocre.
data.text: Granted this was an Auditorium concert night visit, but it's not as if they didn't have warning of the event.  I'd heard many great reviews of the restaurant before they opened one in Lynn, but my experience here wasn't great.

data.title: Great food, service, and comfort..
data.text: You won't go hungry! Burgers are delicious--that's the speciality, but other entrees will serve the palate/stomach also. Can get crowded, pub-like, but that's says people like it!!

data.title: Burgers
data.text: I recently visited this restaurant with family while visiting Boston.  If you love burgers, then this place is for you. There is a variety of burgers to fit your taste buds.  However for vegetarians, the menu does not offer much variety. Although I enjoyed the veggie burger, I would have preferred a portobello burger.

data.title: Awesome Burger Menu!
data.text: There’s a (fairly) new burger place in town – and boy is it good!  We went for the first (but not the last) time recently and a great dining experience.  We were greeted warmly and seated immediately.  Loved the atmosphere!  The menu is very impressive – tons of different burgers as well as other goodies.  One of my friends actually ordered a Sausage Pepper and Onion Sub ($8.95) and said it was delicious.  The rest of us all ordered burgers.  My husband and I went “basic” for our first visit and ordered Cheeseburgers ($9.95).  They were out of this world!  Another friend ordered the Dirty Bird ($10.50), which is a burger topped with a fried egg and homemade BBQ sauce.  He loved it!  All of the burgers are complemented with lettuce, tomato, onion or extra cheese if so desired.  Their “claim to fame” is that they do not “squish” the burgers while they are cooking so that they are juicier.  Works for me!  Beers are in the $4.50 (Coors) to $6.25 (Allagash/BlueMoon) range.  All in all, dinner for 4 came in under $60 – and we were all quite happy (and full).  We were also in agreement that we will be back!

data.title: delicious burgers and wonderful service
data.text: 4 of us went to visit here the other day.  3 ordered different types of burgers and all loved them.  I only eat veggie burgers and allow you to choose any of their options using a veggie burger.  Service is very friendly and helpful.

data.title: Great Burgers
data.text: We went to the Lynn location (closer to home) after hearing so much about how great the burgers are at the Somerville location.  We went on Mother's Day and I was a little concerned that it might be crowded but luck was with us and we got a table right away.  I had the stuffed blue cheese burger with a 1/2 order of onion rings and fries.  The burger was cooked perfect and stuffed and topped with blue cheese it was great.  We will definitely go back.

data.title: Awesome burgers!
data.text: The burgers are great!  Went one night and the owner greeted us which was nice.  We were also there one night for music which we enjoyed.  It was a small crowd but it was fun.  Will go back again!

data.title: Burger haven!
data.text: A few friends after having some microbrew at nearby Bent Water Brewery's tap room.  Excellent service and food.  Nice atmosphere with friendly staff.  The burgers were fantastic.  All real beef, handmade burgers (not pre-made).  Nice beers and ciders on tap.  Would recommend for anyone in a burger and beer mood.

data.title: Very Good
data.text: They serve very good burgers and lots of people goes there to have a drink and watch sports. Nice environment!

data.title: Awesome addition for downtown dining options!
data.text:
Very nice place, plenty of parking close by.  Nice after work crowd on Thursday and Fridays.  Also, a family friendly place!
Burgers are top notch!!!!!

data.title: just ok
data.text: crowded and loud and somewhat expensive.  tried the place 3 times and have not been real happy with any outcomes.  big burgers,big buns and prices that should be lower.

data.title: Best burger around...
data.text: Holy burgers! I am so stuffed hours later.. I heard that the burgers were great but I had to get the onion rings and french fries. I ate it all...not a morsel left on the plate. The service was outstanding and so on point with the dinners, drinks, and followed up with us many times. Will return soon, if possible tomorrow.

data.title: Great burger and onion rings
data.text:
Damn good burger...... 
Try their chunky fries and onion rings.. All prepared fresh (not from a bag).
Pub type feel - but go there for burger and you won't be disappointed ...

data.title: Best place in Lynn for a Bruger
data.text:
I took my parents here for a cold beer and a burger. We had seen them on a local tv program. That show said it was one of the best, and they were right. The portions are huge and the diversity of their burgers was extensive. 

We really loved it and we will be back!

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: Been here 3 times and ordered a medium rare burger but received a well done burger all 3 times! I live in lynn and love spending my money in lynn but I wont be back here. They were completely empty on a Friday night.
